column5: hey all. the guide on the rod closest to the reel broke so I was wondering if anyone had an idea of what the older rods warranty was.  I don't have the model number with me now but I will when I get home this evening.  It was a nice and light rod that my daughter really liked.  No clue how the ring actually rotted in one spot as she never kept her hook on the ring.  I told her not to as she could knick the ring and cut the line so she listened and never did it again.  Thanks all G
Thanks and this rod is WAY more than one year old.  Wasn't sure if they had good warranty like Shimano once did (lifetime)
I have a few of the old Diawa Heartland rods, they worked well for me.

Heartlands have one year warranty, I don't know where you live but any rod/reel repair shop can replace the guides, Aikman's in Mississauga is an authorized Daiwa service centre, They will have the right parts.

Heartlands have one year warranty, I don't know where you live but any rod/reel repair shop can replace the guides, Aikman's in Mississauga is an authorized Daiwa service centre, They will have the right parts. Thanks but for my 13 year old daughter I got her a new rod and she's happy with it (shimano).  I had hope for warranty is all but thanks all
